overview.description: Mizoram, located in northeastern India, is known for its hilly terrain, lush forests, and vibrant tribal culture. Established as a state on February 20, 1987, it features attractions like Aizawl and Tam Dil.

top_destinations.name: Aizawl
top_destinations.description: The capital with Durtlang Hills and local markets.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Bara Bazar; explore the hills.

top_destinations.name: Tam Dil
top_destinations.description: A serene lake surrounded by forests.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Take a boat ride; carry picnic supplies.

top_destinations.name: Champhai
top_destinations.description: A scenic town near the Myanmar border.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Murlen National Park; carry warm clothes.

culinary_delights.name: Baibawl Restaurant
culinary_delights.description: Known for bai and smoked meat.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: Skyline Restaurant
culinary_delights.description: Popular for Indian and local fusion.

must_visit_spots.name: Durtlang Hills
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit early morning for clear skies.

must_visit_spots.name: Tam Dil Lake
must_visit_spots.description: A peaceful lake for boating and picnics.
must_visit_spots.tip: Take a boat ride at sunrise.

must_visit_spots.name: Murlen National Park
must_visit_spots.description: Home to diverse flora and fauna.

must_visit_spots.name: Hmuifang Tlang
must_visit_spots.description: A scenic hill with trekking trails.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Aizawl is 450 km from Guwahati (NH306, 10-12 hrs). By train: Nearest railhead Silchar (180 km). By air: Lengpui Airport (Aizawl).
travel_essentials.tips: Carry warm clothing; check travel advisories.
